block.p: Marie Herb and William Hughes Henning were married yesterday at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy in Buzzards Bay, Mass. Jeannette T. Normandin, who was appointed a Massachusetts civil marriage celebrant for the day, officiated.

Ms. Herb, 36, is keeping her name. She is a program manager at the Technical Assistance Collaborative in Boston, which provides services, including training, to groups that serve disabled and homeless people. She graduated from Rutgers University and received a master's degree in urban planning from the New School for Social Research. She is a daughter of Catherine F. and John G. Herb of West New York, N.J. Her father retired as a captain in Precinct 6 of the West New York Fire Department. Her mother retired as a teller for Provident Savings Bank in West New York.

Marie Herb and William Hughes Henning were married yesterday at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy in Buzzards Bay, Mass. Jeannette T. Normandin, who was appointed a Massachusetts civil marriage celebrant for the day, officiated.

Ms. Herb, 36, is keeping her name. She is a program manager at the Technical Assistance Collaborative in Boston, which provides services, including training, to groups that serve disabled and homeless people. She graduated from Rutgers University and received a master's degree in urban planning from the New School for Social Research. She is a daughter of Catherine F. and John G. Herb of West New York, N.J. Her father retired as a captain in Precinct 6 of the West New York Fire Department. Her mother retired as a teller for Provident Savings Bank in West New York.

Mr. Henning, 44, is the director of the Cape Organization for Rights of the Disabled, a social services and advocacy organization in Hyannis, Mass. He graduated magna cum laude from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. He is the son of Virginia H. Henning of Holden, Mass., and the late William A. Henning. His father retired as a second vice president for group insurance at the State Mutual Life Insurance Company in Worcester, Mass. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
